thread.title: Crown Castle Q3 net income down slightly
thread.title_full: Crown Castle Q3 net income down slightly - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Crown Castle Q3 net income down slightly
text:
Photo: Gary Fountain, Freelance Image 1 of / 1 1 This commissioned artwork by Joe Aker, is at the entrance to Crown Castle offices at 1220 Augusta Drive. Crown Castle is the nation's largest provider of wireless infrastructure. (For the Chronicle/Gary Fountain, June 5, 2015) This commissioned artwork by Joe Aker, is at the entrance to Crown Castle offices at 1220 Augusta Drive. Crown Castle is the nation's largest provider of wireless infrastructure. (For the Chronicle/Gary ... more Crown Castle Q3 net income down slightly 1 / 1 Back to Gallery Crown Castle on Wednesday announced slightly lower net income for its third quarter from a year ago but also higher revenue from leasing space on its wireless infrastructure.
Net income for the quarter was $103.8 million, compared to $108 million last year. Revenue from renting space on cell towers and distributed antenna systems was $764.6 million, up from $717.6 million in the third quarter of 2014.
The Houston-based company manages wireless infrastructure and has benefitted from the boom in cellular data use as consumers shop, watch TV and do many other things on their smartphones and tablets. Distributed antenna systems - fiber-optic cable that connects systems of antennas, or small cells - are a growing and lucrative part of Crown Castle's market. The technology is used to bolster service in malls, downtown areas and other places with high data demand.
In the third quarter, Crown Castle completed the purchase of Sunesys for $1 billion to double its capacity for distributed antenna systems.
"All four major U.S. wireless carriers continue to upgrade and enhance their networks to meet ever increasing consumer demand for mobile broadband," CEO Ben Moreland said in a statement. "Our leadership position in U.S. wireless infrastructure and strong balance sheet underscore our confidence that we can achieve our goal of generating compounded annual growth in dividend per share of 6% to 7% over the next several years."
The company also raised its expectations for earnings next quarter and in 2016. Executives will host a call to discuss the current results on Thursday morning.
